docs.title: Welcome to DracoByte Docs 🚀
docs.text: Welcome to the official DracoByte Hosting documentation! Here you’ll find everything you need to get started, fix problems, and make the most of your Minecraft server.

docs.title: 🧭 Quick Links
docs.text:
• Getting Started
  • Troubleshooting
  • FAQ

Need more help? Join our Discord Community for live support.

docs.title: 💸 Is DracoByte really free?
docs.text: Yes! We offer 4 GB RAM servers for free — supported by ads. You can upgrade to premium for more resources or dedicated slots.

docs.title: ⚡ How do I upgrade my server?
docs.text:
1. Visit the DracoByte Billing Panel.
  2. Choose a premium plan that fits your needs.
  3. Complete checkout — your server upgrades automatically.

docs.title: 🧩 Can I install mods or plugins?
docs.text: Absolutely! - For mods: upload .jar files and select a Forge or Fabric egg. - For plugins: use the Plugins folder with Paper or Purpur.

docs.title: 🧹 My server was suspended — what now?
docs.text:
Servers can be suspended for: - Inactivity - Excessive CPU abuse - Violation of our Terms of Service

If suspended, check your email or Discord for details. You can reactivate or appeal via a support ticket.

docs.title: 🧠 Where can I get help?
docs.text: Join our Discord Community or open a ticket through your panel.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to DracoByte Hosting! 🎉 This guide will help you create your first Minecraft server in just a few minutes.

docs.title: 🪄 Step 1: Create an Account
docs.text:
1. Go to https://dracobyte.pro/
  2. Scroll down to the Plans section (or click Get Started For Free at the top).
  3. Choose your preferred plan — most players start with the Free 4 GB plan.
  4. Click Deploy Now to start the checkout process.
  5. Complete the cart to create your account and deploy your first server.

💡 Verify your email when prompted — this unlocks access to your panel.

docs.title: 🧱 Step 2: Access the Game Panel
docs.text:
Once your order is complete: - Go to https://game.dracobyte.pro/ - Log in using the same credentials you created during checkout. - You’ll see your new server in the dashboard.

From here you can: - Start, stop, or restart your server - Access the live console - Manage or upload files (worlds, plugins, etc.) - Change Minecraft versions or reinstall your server

docs.title: 🌍 Step 3: Join Your Server
docs.text:
1. Launch Minecraft.
  2. Click Multiplayer → Add Server.
  3. Enter your server IP (shown in your DracoByte panel).
  4. Click Join Server and start playing!

docs.title: 🚀 Next Steps
docs.text:
• Troubleshooting Guide
  • FAQ
  • Need personal help? Join our Discord

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Having issues with your server? Try these quick fixes.

docs.title: 🛑 Server Won’t Start
docs.text:
Possible Causes - Missing or invalid server.jar - Not enough allocated memory (RAM) - Outdated or incompatible mods/plugins - Corrupted world files

Fix 1. Check the Console for any red error lines. 2. If using a custom jar, make sure the filename is exactly server.jar. 3. Stop the server → go to Settings → Reinstall Server (if needed). 4. If it still fails, open a ticket — include your console log.

docs.title: 🐢 Lag or TPS Drops
docs.text: Quick Fixes - Reduce render distance in your Minecraft client. - Remove unused plugins or mods. - Avoid large redstone clocks or auto farms. - Upgrade to a premium plan for higher CPU and RAM limits.

docs.title: 🧾 Connection Issues
docs.text: If players can’t join: - Make sure the server is started. - Check if your IP or port changed (displayed in the panel). - Ensure you’re connecting to the correct version (e.g., 1.21, 1.20.6). - Restart the server after uploading a new jar or plugin pack.

docs.title: 🔄 File Upload Errors
docs.text:
• Use the File Manager or SFTP (see connection info in the panel).
  • Large uploads may time out — compress worlds into .zip first.
  • Restart the server after uploading new files.

docs.title: 💬 Still Stuck?
docs.text: Open a support ticket or join our Discord with your server name and issue description.
